apis.description: Given a user ID, return a paginated list of that user's logins for the given account.

operations.notes: Given a user ID, return a paginated list of that user's logins for the given account.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

response_fields.name: account_id
response_fields.description: The ID of the login's account.

response_fields.name: id
response_fields.description: The unique, numeric ID for the login.

response_fields.name: sis_user_id
response_fields.description: The login's unique SIS ID.

response_fields.name: integration_id
response_fields.description: The login's unique integration ID.

response_fields.name: unique_id
response_fields.description: The unique ID for the login.

response_fields.name: user_id
response_fields.description: The unique ID of the login's user.

response_fields.name: authentication_provider_id
response_fields.description:
The ID of the authentication
provider that this login is associated with

response_fields.name: authentication_provider_type
response_fields.description:
The type of the authentication
provider that this login is associated with

response_fields.name: workflow_state
response_fields.description: The current status of the login

response_fields.name: declared_user_type
response_fields.description: The declared intention for this user's role

apis.description: Create a new login for an existing user in the given account.

operations.notes: Create a new login for an existing user in the given account.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: user[id]
parameters.description: The ID of the user to create the login for.

parameters.name: login[unique_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID for the new login.

parameters.name: login[password]
parameters.description: The new login's password.

parameters.name: login[sis_user_id]
parameters.description:
SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to
manage SIS permissions on the account.

parameters.name: login[integration_id]
parameters.description:
Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to
manage SIS permissions on the account. The Integration ID is a secondary
identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.

parameters.name: login[authentication_provider_id]
parameters.description:
The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins
associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider.
Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with
them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins
explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the
provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the
first matching provider).

parameters.name: login[declared_user_type]
parameters.description:
The declared intention of the user type. This can be set, but does
not change any Canvas functionality with respect to their access.
A user can still be a teacher, admin, student, etc. in any particular
context without regard to this setting. This can be used for
administrative purposes for integrations to be able to more easily
identify why the user was created.
Valid values are:
  * administrative
  * observer
  * staff
  * student
  * student_other
  * teacher

apis.description: Update an existing login for a user in the given account.

operations.notes: Update an existing login for a user in the given account.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: login[unique_id]
parameters.description: The new unique ID for the login.

parameters.name: login[password]
parameters.description:
The new password for the login. Can only be set by an admin user if admins
are allowed to change passwords for the account.

parameters.name: login[sis_user_id]
parameters.description:
SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to
manage SIS permissions on the account.

parameters.name: login[integration_id]
parameters.description:
Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to
manage SIS permissions on the account. The Integration ID is a secondary
identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.

parameters.name: login[authentication_provider_id]
parameters.description:
The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins
associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider.
Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with
them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins
explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the
provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the
first matching provider).

parameters.name: login[workflow_state]
parameters.description: Used to suspend or re-activate a login.

parameters.name: login[declared_user_type]
parameters.description:
The declared intention of the user type. This can be set, but does
not change any Canvas functionality with respect to their access.
A user can still be a teacher, admin, student, etc. in any particular
context without regard to this setting. This can be used for
administrative purposes for integrations to be able to more easily
identify why the user was created.
Valid values are:
  * administrative
  * observer
  * staff
  * student
  * student_other
  * teacher

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID
